DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: Saraiva, A. L.;Saraiva, A.;SARAIVA, ANDRE;SARAIVA, ANDRЙ;SARAIVA, A L

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduaзгo, mestrado, doutorado e pуs-doutorado em Fisica pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2005, 2007, 2011 e 2013 respectivamente). Realizou estбgio de doutorado (2010) e pуs-doutorado (2014) na University of Wisconsin. Й Professor Adjunto A de Fнsica na UFRJ. Tem experiкncia na бrea de Fнsica, com кnfase em Nanoestruturas Semicondutoras e Computaзгo Quвntica com Spins em Semicondutores. Й Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa nнvel 2 do CNPq.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor's, Master's, PhD and post-Doc from Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (2005, 2007, 2011 and 2013 respectively). Research intern (2010) and post-doctoral research associate (2014) at University of Wisconsin. Has experience in semiconductor nanostructures, quantum computation and quantum electronics in semiconductors.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Saraiva, A. L.;Saraiva, A.;SARAIVA, ANDRE;SARAIVA, ANDRЙ;SARAIVA, A L

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Physical mechanisms for interface-mediated intervalley coupling in Si
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Physical mechanisms for interface-mediated intervalley coupling in Si

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The conduction band degeneracy in Si is detrimental to quantum computing based on spin qubits, for which a nondegenerate ground orbital state is desirable. This degeneracy is lifted at an interface with an insulator as the spatially abrupt change in the conduction band minimum leads to intervalley scattering. We present a theoretical study of the interface-induced valley splitting in Si that provides simple criteria for optimal fabrication parameters to maximize this splitting. Our work emphasizes the relevance of different interface-related properties to the valley splitting.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The conduction band degeneracy in Si is detrimental to quantum computing based on spin qubits, for which a nondegenerate ground orbital state is desirable. This degeneracy is lifted at an interface with an insulator as the spatially abrupt change in the conduction band minimum leads to intervalley scattering. We present a theoretical study of the interface-induced valley splitting in Si that provides simple criteria for optimal fabrication parameters to maximize this splitting. Our work emphasizes the relevance of different interface-related properties to the valley splitting.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Physical mechanisms of interface-mediated intervalley coupling in Si
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Physical mechanisms of interface-mediated intervalley coupling in Si

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Absence of Valley Degeneracy in Si/SiO2 Interfaces
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Absence of Valley Degeneracy in Si/SiO2 Interfaces

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The excitation energy between the two lowest orbital levels of electrons in Si/SiO2 quantum wells is investigated theoretically. The valley degeneracy is shown to be lifted well beyond the interface induced valley splitting in certain regimes. We identify these regimes as being those where strong hybridization between the well states and intrinsic interface states happen. It is demonstrated that the ubiquitous disorder in Si/SiO2 interfaces enhances the excitation energy through this mechanism. We also show indications that these hybrid states are not laterally confined by Anderson localization, and therefore they contribute to electronic transport.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The excitation energy between the two lowest orbital levels of electrons in Si/SiO2 quantum wells is investigated theoretically. The valley degeneracy is shown to be lifted well beyond the interface induced valley splitting in certain regimes. We identify these regimes as being those where strong hybridization between the well states and intrinsic interface states happen. It is demonstrated that the ubiquitous disorder in Si/SiO2 interfaces enhances the excitation energy through this mechanism. We also show indications that these hybrid states are not laterally confined by Anderson localization, and therefore they contribute to electronic transport.
